docs.lead_paragraph: The Senate having removed the injunction of secrecy, Mr. SOULE is entitled to the floor tomorrow on the CLAYTON and BULWER Treaty, and will speak, if his health (which is not good to-day)

headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY.; THOMAS F. MEAGHER DEFINING HIS POSITION. LOVE, JEALOUSY, AND A THREATENING LETER. MR. FRY'S SEVENTH LECTURE ON MUSIC. FIRE IN PINE-ST. FALSE ALARM. COURT OF GENERAL SESSIONS

docs.lead_paragraph: The "Meagher Club" gave a ball and supper at Niblo's Garden on Monday night, which THOS. F. MEAGHER attended, Immediately after delivering his lecture on Australia before the Mercantile Library Association. A magnificent supper was provided at 1 o'clock.
docs.abstract: Speech at the Meagher Club Supper

docs.lead_paragraph: General PIERCE left the Eagle Hotel, for Andover, in the 10 o'clock train this morning. He obtained a comfortable night's rest at Mr. WILLIAMS'S, his old boarding house-resting more quietly than during any night since the accident. He was greatly prostrated by the melancholy duties of yesterday, and suffered considerably also from the strains and bruises which he sustained. .

docs.lead_paragraph: The Valedictory Message of Gov. FRENCH, of Illinois is a document of fair length. The Governor opens by declaring that the meeting of the- General Assembly usually carries with it associations connected with the leading and most important interests of the State.

headline.main: XXXIId CONGRESS...Second Session.; THE CLAYTON AND BULWER TREATY. Vindication of Gen. Taylor's Administration. Speeches of Messrs, Pearce and Seward. IN SENATE... HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES. NEW-YORK LEGISLATURE. ASSEMBLY.

docs.lead_paragraph: Mr. PEARCE of Md., said he was not present on Thursday last when the debate took place, or he would then have replied to the remarks made by, the Senator from Louisiana.
docs.snippet: Mr. PEARCE of Md., said he was not present on Thursday last when the debate took place, or he would then have replied to the remarks made by, the Senator from Louisiana.

docs.lead_paragraph: The funeral services on the son of Gen. FRANK LIN PIERCE took place this morning at the house of Mr. AIKEN, in Andover. The attendance was large, embracing many of the citizens of Andover, the professors, and students of the seminary, and quite a number of the family relatives of Gen. PIERCE from this city.

docs.lead_paragraph: ANNUAL REPORT OF THE HEALTH OFFICER OF BROOKLYN.--The Health Officer, M. WENDELL, M. D., made his annual report to the Common Council last evening. From this report we gather the following particulars.

docs.lead_paragraph: We have European news one week later, viz., to Christmas Day, by the arrival of the R. M. steamship America, at Halifax yesterday. The English ministry is not yet completed under the Premiership of the Earl of ABERDEEN. He is at the head of the Government, with the concurrence of Lord LANSDOWNE. It is expected, (though it does not seem likely,) that Lord JOHN RUSSELL will consent to take the Foreign Office,

headline.main: THE UNITED STATES AND MEXICO.; History of the Attempts of the French to Colonize Northern Mexico. PART III. My Travels in America--Their Objects, and the Results Obtained.

docs.lead_paragraph: When I left France in Nov. 1847, to direct my steps towards America, I was guided by the conviction that the decisive future for us would be found in the New World. I had already visited...

docs.lead_paragraph: Our special dispatch from Washington, under date of last evening, reports the rumored explanation given by Mr. KING--whose extreme low health renders the controversy at this time much to be regretted-of the discrepaney between his note to Mr. CLAYTON, in 1850, and his verbal statement to Mr. C.ss last week.
